question.title: Spring Boot web app JPA datasource removed - no org.springframework.boot.web.servlet.server.ServletWebServerFactory bean
question.body:
My Spring Boot web app no longer uses a database so I removed all related jpa and hibernate tags, any realated code and entries in application.yml. Now the app does not startup anymore.

I have the spring-boot-starter-web in my pom and also it works fine when I add @SpringBootApplication(exclude = {DataSourceAutoConfiguration.class}) in my main class.*But that is just a workaround.

Description:

Web application could not be started as there was no org.springframework.boot.web.servlet.server.ServletWebServerFactory bean defined in the context.

Action:

Check your application's dependencies for a supported servlet web server.
Check the configured web application type.

answers.body:
Try to delete the .m2 folder, if maven project, or .gradle folder, if gradle project, which lies under the Users/yourUserName and then restart the IDE(Intellij) and reload the whole project and download the sources.

And then try the mvn clean install or ./gradlew clean build

This should probably work for the above issue

question_comments.body: There is too little information. What does your application class look like, which dependencies you have and which properties you still have.
